Patch Set 19: Commit message was updated.
you've marked this as ready to review..... but the lack of testing statement makes me think that's not quite true.  Tested?
Redfish Validator did not show any errors from this change.
please put that in your commit message.
It should be efficient to just copy this boolean

Unfortunately we can't use a boolean here, because there are 3 states:

1. True
2. False
3. Parameter not received

in terms of patterns, a pointer seems to be the best answer we have so far for solving the three states.
possible nullptr dereference here.  If the branch on line 500 never returns true, this will dereference nullptr.
This seems fixed now. If |isLocked == nullptr|, we won't go into this branch.
Also looks like you added PredictedMediaLifeLeftPercent?
It's not about testing, it's about you making a list of changes in your commit message, and that not matching up with the actual changes you made in code.
Didn't mean to open this as resolved.

Using nested if else is hard to read.

Please return at line 514. This applies to other branches that could return earlier.
done, I moved the logic around to decrease the nest depth.

Isn't there an Unknown here 
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/0f97c461bd0dd7486b29cc07cb721f7b9f94256e/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Inventory/Item/Drive.interface.yaml#L91
?

E.g. if you have a drive with xyz.openbmc_project.Drive.DriveEncryptionState.Unknown, it shows as Unencrypted with this logic
I think this conflicts with your other patch, please rebase.
I didn't find a condition which covers "Encrypted but not locked" case? Isn't that valid case?
shouldn't it be "Encrypted and Locked" for more user-friendly?

No Ankita, It should follow DMTF redfish "Drive" schema. Property name should be "EncryptionStatus" and value should be one of below enum.
        "EncryptionStatus": {
            "enum": [
                "Unecrypted",
                "Unlocked",
                "Locked",
                "Foreign",
                "Unencrypted"
            ],
            
https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/Drive_v1.xml
same comment as above.."Encrypted and Unlocked"
Same as above, Should follow DMTF Redfish schema. And its fine.
